intro: Carphalea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy carphalea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds and bees. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical research.
